text: How are people handling related pages - for example “Services”, with a listing page and a detail page for each individual service?

hubdb is an option.. but it’s a bit confusing for clients as it’s not editable inline and if the client wants to have a specific template for a service it’s not ideal. I was also thinking of using “content_by_ids”, and having a repeater field for the page editor to select the services
have you checked this <@UQERM7BLY> <https://designers.HubSpot.com/blog/creating-a-portfolio-with-HubSpot-cos>
Nice idea - my only issue with that route is that any custom fields (modules) can’t be accessed on the listing page, right?
Can you have 2 expression tests in an if loop.index? ie. {% if loop.index > 4 AND < 10 %} ?
` {% if loop.index > 4 and loop.index < 10 %} `
Bingo! thank you <@UKQP9KM8A> makes sense now:man-facepalming:
How do I use the `{% video_player %}` embed video player inside a custom module?
I have to use a rich text and then embed?

Is there any customization you can do to the video_player ? looks like it is using an iframe implementation. Is it possible to use a vidyard embed using JS or any way we can trigger a click on the iframe? The use case here is having a button on a page that opens a modal and allows us to play the video upon the button click -- and in that modal having a close button that closes and pauses the video.

If that isn't possible, is there a way to use the video as a link vs showing the video background?
I don’t think its possible at the moment.
yeah, appears to be behind a paywall -- pay for vidyard starter and you can have the other options
gave it my upvote anyway just in case
Is it possible to use a relative path in `{% import %}` and `{% include %}`? Something like, `{% include '../partials/global-head.html' %}`?
I've thought to try that once and never bothered. I'd say try it out and let us know!
Yep! You can reference files or modules by relative or absolute paths
Hm, I must have my path wrong then. I always get this syntax wrong :p. Good to know it works, I’ll keep trying I guess.
There are some examples you can check out in the boilerplate <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/blob/master/src/templates/layouts/base.html>
Does it work in drag-and-drop templates? I think that might be my problem.

Hi,
I am wondering the Blog count on blog listing page.
I want to display blog count for specific topic.
Same as blog-filter but only display case-study(topic) count.
Thanks
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/en/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-functions#blog-tags> You can iterate through tags and counts..
<@UG52C29EE> Thanks for reply. I need count after for loop which is not working. I found jQuery solution for this. Thanks for your time!! :slightly_smiling_face:
